Prepare this package for use by passing in the data from your koji.json

this function will also do some basic structural checks.

comment.shortText: Verifies that client-side methods are used only in frontend services of the Koji.
comment.returns: Method's behavior or an error, if the method is being invoked in a node/backend environment.

comment.text: Class to which the method belongs.
Method name.

comment.shortText: Enables you to track custom events in your Koji templates. For example, track `onClick` events for the links and buttons in a Koji.
comment.text:
To view the analytics data for your published Koji, go to **Manage this Koji > Open Creator Dashboard > Open Analytics**. You will see data for your custom events along with a standard set of built-in metrics, which are calculated from the Kojis access logs.

Analytics data is processed at frequent intervals throughout the day. If you are testing the custom events in a published template and you dont see results at first, wait 10 minutes to account for data processing latency, and then check again.

comment.shortText: Generates an analytics event with the specified name and data payload, if applicable.
comment.returns: Indicates whether the event was generated.

comment.text: Name of the custom event.
List of custom key-value pairs to save with the event.

comment.shortText: Manages in-app purchase transactions on the frontend of your Koji.
Sets a listener for a specific event, and invokes a function to handle the event.

comment.text: Function to run when the event is fired.
Name of the event.
Data to be sent to the Koji.

comment.shortText: Prompts the user to purchase a product from the Koji. Products are defined in the entitlements file and registered or updated when the Koji is published.

comment.text: Identifier for the product to purchase.

comment.shortText: Results of an in-app purchase transaction.
Unique identifier for the receipt, if the purchase was successful, or `undefined`, if not.
Indicates whether the purchase was successful.
Temporary token for the current users session. See [[getToken]].
Custom information to add to a [[IapReceipt | transaction receipt]] for a given in-app purchase.
Amount of the purchase.
Custom message associated with the purchase. This value is stored as a custom attribute on the [[IapReceipt | transaction receipt]].
Capabilities that a user can grant the current Koji authorization to use.
Allows the current Koji to send push notifications to the user.
Creates a unique ID for the user on the current Koji, and allows the Koji to map the users token to a persistent user ID in storage, such as a backend database.
Manages authentication and authorization on the frontend of your Koji.
Checks whether the user has granted authorizations to the Koji. Use this method to determine whether to request authorization for certain capabilities.
comment.returns: Indicates whether the user has already granted authorization for the capabilities.

comment.text: List of authorization grants to check for the user.

comment.shortText: Sets a listener for a specific event, and invokes a function to handle the event.

comment.text: Function to run when the event is fired.
Name of the event.

comment.shortText: Gets a token identifying the current user.
Requests the specified authorization grants from the user for the Koji.

comment.text: List of {@link AuthGrantCapability| authorization grants} to request from the user.
Custom message to display when requesting the grant.
Data to be sent to the Koji.

comment.shortText: Listens to changes in remix state and invokes a callback function to enable different experiences during remix, preview, or use.
comment.returns: Function to unsubscribe from remix state listener.

comment.shortText: Describes the remixer's editor.
[[EditorType]]
Distinguishes between a `new` remix and an `edit` to the users existing Koji.
Type of editor, either `instant` for an instant remix or `full` for the code editor.
Function to handle changes in remix state. Receives the `isRemixing` and `editorAttributes` properties as inputs.
Function to handle changes in remix state. Receives the `isRemixing` and `editorAttributes` properties as inputs.

comment.text: Indicates whether the Koji is in remixing mode.

comment.shortText: Context in which the Koji is being viewed. A Koji can provide a distinct experience for each context.
Who is viewing the receipt for a transaction, either `buyer` or `seller`.
Who is viewing the receipt for a transaction, either `buyer` or `seller`.
Manages the remixing experience for your Koji.
Retrieves sensitive data that was {@link encryptValue | stored as an encrypted value}.
comment.text: Only the creator of the Koji can access the decrypted value with this method. For example, to check that the value was entered correctly. To retrieve the value for other users, use {@link resolveValue} on the backend.
Path where the encrypted value is stored.

comment.shortText: Stores sensitive data as an encrypted value. The sensitive data can only be accessed programmatically and is not available when the Koji is remixed.
comment.returns: Path where the encrypted value is stored. Use this value to {@link decryptValue | decrypt the value} on the frontend, for the creator, or to {@link resolveValue | resolve the value} on the backend, for other users.

comment.text: Value to encrypt.

comment.shortText: Sets a listener for a specific event, and invokes a function to handle the event.

comment.text: Function to run when the event is fired.
Name of the event.

Replaces all remix data with the specified object.
comment.text: This method overwrites all existing values in the remix data. To update specific values only, use [[set]].
comment.returns: Indicates whether the remix data was successfully replaced.

comment.text: Object containing the new remix data for the Koji.
Data to be sent to the Koji.

Updates the specified values in the remix data.
comment.text: This method updates only the values that are specified in `newValue`. If other values exist, they not changed. To replace all remix data, use [[overwrite]].
comment.returns: Indicates whether the values were successfully updated.

comment.text: Key-value pairs to update in the remix data.

comment.shortText: Captures user input on the frontend of your Koji.
Prompts the user to select a color, either from a swatch or by entering a color code. Supports HEX, RGB, or HSL by default. Supports RBGA or HSLA, if transparency is enabled in the capture options.

comment.text: Indicates whether to return additional metadata about the capture event. If `false` or not specified, returns the color code as a string.

comment.shortText: Sets a listener for a specific event, and invokes a function to handle the event.

comment.text: Function to run when the event is fired.
Name of the event.

comment.shortText: Prompts the user to upload a file of any type. Use this method to allow the user to upload raw files in their original format. For example, to capture high-resolution images for download rather than for display in a browser.
comment.text: To apply automatic transcoding and transformations for specific file types, use the associated method. See [[image]], [[video]], [[sound]], or [[media]].
Indicates whether to return additional metadata about the capture event. If `false` or not specified, returns the URL to the file as a string.

comment.shortText: Prompts the user to select an image by selecting from the available asset packs, by uploading a file, or by entering a URL. Use this method when you want to limit the user to selecting an image.
comment.text: To allow multiple types of media assets, see [[media]]. To allow upload of raw files of any type, see [[file]].
Indicates whether to return additional metadata about the capture event. If `false` or not specified, returns the URL to the image asset as a string.

comment.shortText: Prompts the user to create a new Koji or select an existing Koji, either from the users profile or from a URL.

comment.text: Indicates whether to return additional metadata about the capture event. If `false` or not specified, returns the URL to the Koji as a string.

comment.shortText: Prompts the user to select an image, file, sound, or video by selecting from the available asset packs, by uploading a file, or by entering a URL. Use this method to allow the user to select from more than one type of media with a single control. For example, allow the user to select an image or a video. You can limit the types of media to allow and configure options for each allowed type.

comment.text: Indicates whether to return additional metadata about the capture event. If `false` or not specified, returns only the value of the media capture, which is either the URL to the media as a string or an object with the URL and additional metadata.

comment.shortText: Prompts the user to select a numeric value within a certain range. You can configure the minimum value, maximum value, and default increment.
comment.returns: Numeric value as a string or the [[CaptureValue]] object, if `verbose` is `true`.

comment.text: Indicates whether to return additional metadata about the capture event. If `false` or not specified, returns the numeric value as a string.

comment.shortText: Prompts the user to select from a predefined list of options.
comment.returns: Value of the predefined option as a string or the [[CaptureValue]] object, if `verbose` is `true`.

comment.text: Indicates whether to return additional metadata about the capture event. If `false` or not specified, returns the option as a string.
Data to be sent to the Koji.
Data to be sent to the Koji.

comment.shortText: Prompts the user to select a sound by selecting from the available asset packs, by uploading a file, or by entering a URL. Use this method when you want to limit the user to selecting a sound.
comment.text: To allow multiple types of media assets, see [[media]]. To allow upload of raw files of any type, see [[file]].
comment.returns: URL to the audio asset as a string or the [[CaptureValue]] object, if `verbose` is `true`.

comment.text: Indicates whether to return additional metadata about the capture event. If `false` or not specified, returns the URL to the audio asset as a string.

comment.shortText: Configuration options for a [[color]] capture.
Indicates whether to support transparency (`false`, by default).
Configuration options for an [[image]] capture.
Whether to hide all asset packs and VCC extensions. Enable this option in cases where they do not make sense (for example, Kojis for selling premium images).
Configuration options for an [[media]] capture of an image file.
Resizes the image to the specified width.
Configuration options for a [[media]] capture.
Specifies the types of media files to allow. If empty or not specified, any type of file is allowed.
Whether to hide all asset packs and VCC extensions. Enable this option in cases where they do not make sense (for example, when uploading premium content).
Specifies the configuration options for image files.
Specifies the type of the return value for the capture. If empty or not specified, `extended` data is returned.
Specifies the configuration options for video files.
Configuration options for a [[media]] capture of a video file.

Generates pose detection data. When enabled, pose data is available after upload by appending `.poses` to the returned file URL. For example, `https://objects.koji-cdn.com/project-id/my-video.mp4.poses`.

Enables HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) for delivery of longer content. When enabled, uploaded videos are transcoded for HLS and return an m3u8 playlist. Use this feature in conjunction with [[https://github.com/video-dev/hls.js/ | hls.js]] for controlling playback.
Configuration options for the capture. The available options vary by type.
Configuration options for a [[range]] capture.
Maximum value. Default is `100`.
Minimum value. Default is `0`.
Default increment/step size. Default is `1`.
Configuration options for a [[select]] capture.
List of predefined options.
Description of the selection for users.
One of the predefined options for a [[select]] capture.
Description of the option for users.
Value to return if the option is selected.
Configuration options for a [[sound]] capture.
Whether to hide all asset packs and VCC extensions. Enable this option in cases where they do not make sense (for example, Kojis for selling premium sounds).
Result of a user input capture.
Value captured from the user.
Whether the user completed the selection (`succeeded`) or exited the control without selecting a value (`cancelled`).
Capture method type (for example, `color` or `file`).
Configuration options for a [[video]] capture.

Generates pose detection data. When enabled, pose data is available after upload by appending `.poses` to the returned file URL. For example, `https://objects.koji-cdn.com/project-id/my-video.mp4.poses`.

Enables HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) for delivery of longer content. When enabled, uploaded videos are transcoded for HLS and return an m3u8 playlist. Use this feature in conjunction with [[https://github.com/video-dev/hls.js/ | hls.js]] for controlling playback.
Metadata for an audio file.
Duration in seconds for an audio file.
Metadata for an image file.
Natural height of the image in pixels.
Natural width of the image in pixels.
Metadata when the capture option for the return type is set to `extended`.
Metadata for an audio file.
Metadata for an image file.
Size in bytes of the media file.
Type of media: `image`, `video`, `audio`, or `file`.
URL of the selected media file.
Metadata for a video file.
Metadata for a video file.
URL for the video thumbnail.
Result of a [[media]] file capture.
Value captured from the user.
Whether the user completed the selection (`succeeded`) or exited the control without selecting a value (`cancelled`).
Capture method type (for example, `color` or `file`).
Types of files to allow for a [[media]] capture. The [[CaptureMediaOptions | configuration options]] vary by media file type.
Type of value to return for a [[media]] capture. Either the URL to the media as a string or an object with the URL and additional metadata.
Sets a listener for a specific event, and invokes a function to handle the event.

comment.text: Function to run when the event is fired.
Name of the event.
Data to be sent to the Koji.
Data to be sent to the Koji.

comment.shortText: Temporary token for the current users session, or `null` if the user is not logged in.
comment.text: A user token is created when a logged-in user loads a Koji, and destroyed when the user closes the Koji. If the user revisits the Koji, a different token is generated. Tokens are specific to a user and a Koji, so the same user will have different tokens for different Kojis.
